channel.title: 100DaysToOffload on Slices of a hacker's mind
channel.description: Recent content in 100DaysToOffload on Slices of a hacker's mind

item.title: Happy New Year
item.description: Happy new year everyone! With this post, I’ve finished the last post of my 100daystooffload!

item.title: Gogs migration to gitea - part 1
item.description: For a longer time now, I’m using gogs to host my git code.

item.title: Blogging on the Phone
item.description: Had finally some time to figure out a good process for blogging on the phone.

item.title: CI/CD
item.description: I’ve got some time to get back to CI/CD project. At this state I need a way to trigger the update the blog sources from git.

item.title: LineageOS update
item.description: I’ve updated my Android phone and wanted to adde some note about to it.

item.title: Merry Christmas
item.description: I wish everyone a merry Christmas! Best regards, akendo

item.title: Suffering
item.description: In past days, we had a lot of discussion about the subject of suffering.

item.title: What I Have Learned Today
item.description: Today, I have learned that we humans fall prey to ‘directionally motivated reasoning’.

item.title: Extremes
item.description: Recently, I noticed a pattern in my own behaviour and I like the insight about this here.

item.title: Suffocating
item.description: Did you ever felt like that you’re not getting anything done?

item.title: Grep binary
item.description: Short note: One of my script that uses grep broken down in the last week:

item.title: Log4Shell part two
item.description: I did not have much time to get to the log4j exploitation part.

item.title: Log4Shell
item.description: Okay, at this point you already have heard of the new hot shit in the infosec: Log4shell or CVE-2021-44228.

item.title: Hugo Drafts
item.description: One thing that turn a bit of a show stop is the hugo server, there were some changes made in hugo that breaks my template, I guess.

item.title: AES GCM
item.description: Some days ago, we had an interesting discussion about Galois/Counter Mode (GCM).

item.title: Draw.io
item.description: I’ve created a docker-compose.yml file for to run draw.io: draw: restart: always image: fjudith/drawio ports: - "${IP_ADDRESS}8180:8080" depends_on: - nginx-proxy environment: - VIRTUAL_HOST=draw,draw.

item.title: Talented
item.description: In my understanding, talent does not matter. Most people who do a thing do not have any of it.

item.title: Almost 100 Days of writing
item.description: To the beginning of this year I’ve decided to write more for this blog and since then, the end of 2021 is coming to a close.

item.title: Bike
item.description: Today, my bike was stolen. Technically, it was stolen some time ago, but I just learned about it today.

item.title: Depression
item.description: This is kind of my first blog post in ages. Technically, I’ve composed some more in between, however, much of them were really just halfhearted.

item.title: [Task Warrior]Setting a custom time range for the timesheet report
item.description: I’m using the task warrior report function called timesheet. It will return a list of done tast of the past weeks.

item.title: Postgresql User Login
item.description: For the Hedgedoc migration, I had to create a new role and forgot to add the necessary permissions to allow this role to login.

item.title: Cryptographic Agility
item.description: Today, I’ve learned that there is something like a Cryptographic Agility.

item.title: Phone
item.description: This is my first post composed on my phone. It took some time to get here, but it’s finally done!

item.title: Working
item.description: Since two weeks, I’m back at work and boy the first weeks were quite hectic.

item.title: Review CW16
item.description: This post is a bit late, however, better than missed out.

item.description: This post continues on the post from 12 of January[0].

item.description: There is more to the Netstats subject, but I’m going to continue with that later on.

item.title: Netstats
item.description: The next part excites me, I’ve been working on this code on different occasions for some years now.

item.title: Thinking Ahead
item.description: I did not manage to publish a post the recent days, and I’m wondering why.

item.title: Grafana Part2 - waiting sockets
item.description: So the next step was to write a simple loop in bash and get every second the data.

item.title: Review CW14
item.description: This last week was suffered the typical post-easter slowness. It takes some time to get back to business as usually.

item.description: In the past days, I’ve been busy with the migration of my old server.

item.title: Review CW13
item.description: Happy Easter everyone! The past week was rather low in activity due to my health and the health of other around.

item.title: Conflict
item.description: Yesterday, I wrote about a conflict with a friend and I like to reflect a bit on.

item.title: Cold Two
item.description: Here is a status update: In the last days, I’ve been stay getting healthier and while my physical form became ready, mentally I felt not well enough to write until today.

item.title: Cold
item.description: Hey everyone, unfortunate I turn sick. Last week some relative turn sick and some day later the next one.

item.title: Pineview
item.description: Pineview is back online! After some fighting with the routing I got part of my services back online.

item.title: Check Ins
item.description: Some years ago, a friend of mine went to the Recurse Center[0] in New York.

item.description: Today my emerge was complain that it was able to re-emerge app-text/po4a-0.

item.description: Currently, I’ve halted most of these project to favor to get my CI/CD back.

item.description: A friend made a question about some rust puns on Twitter[0].

item.title: Dependency Hell
item.description: Why is the CI/CD project blocked? Because my server I was running things on broke, and I’m left with a year-old laptop.

item.title: Habit Score
item.description: For long, I’ve used the Habit Tracker[0] to keep track of my daily routines.

item.title: Broken SPI Chip
item.description: I’ve been working on my CI/CD system and because the firmware update went bad I had to dissemble the device and attach to the SPI Chip.

item.title: Review CW10
item.description: Another week has gone by, and I did not get that much done as I was hoping for.

item.title: Goaccess
item.description: To see how much people reading this blog I utilize goaccess[0].

item.title: About Gaming
item.description: I’m reading a text about quitting video games[0]. I think he has some good points, but makes also quite generic statement.

item.title: Faceboom
item.description: You may or may not have heard from the ‘Slashdot effect’[0].

item.title: Review CW09
item.description: Gosh, I’ve manage to not get any post done in a week!

item.title: Review CW08
item.description: This week was the best so far. I finished up the kernel exploration and will move next week to the next chapter.

item.description: With my affords to fix pineview, I’m in the situation to think about what I want to have for a CI/CD.

item.description: Pineview was my old production server at home. It did run many services like git, and I planned to use it be part of my CI/CD.

item.title: Review CW07
item.description: This week was the worst in terms of writing. This is to the fact, that I had to care for someone and wasn’t able to take the time I needed for writing.

item.description: Many years ago, I moved to my first flat for my schooling.

item.description: This is part two of my Media Wiki documenation[0]. It has been a while since I’ve looked at this matter, but I planed it to progrss for this.

item.title: Blogfixes
item.description: Today was a quite busy day with minor things. I’ve fixed the Hugo related things and updated the contact page to be reachable again.

item.title: Fix Mathjs in Hugo
item.description: With the change to shortcodes, Hugo seemed to have drop support for inline HTML code in markdown.

item.title: Kernel Exploitation Intro
item.description: One of my plans was to learn about security[0]. My ToDo list is massively full of different topics I want to put some attention on.

item.title: Review CW4
item.description: This week the first difficulties in writing every arise. Basically, I’m missing the necessary time to get things done.

item.title: The defining narrative
item.description: In this post[0], I wanted to think about feedback. While I was writing on it, I notice how I was slowly drifting.

item.title: Set a new posts in Hugo to draft
item.description: I put all the posts by default draft mode. This is done by having an archtype[0] document.

item.title: a learning mindset
item.description: In the recent days, I’ve got some neat feedback about some posts and I must say that I love it.

item.title: Alone
item.description: You’re at a party, talking to your friends and feeling comfortably at first.

item.title: Review CW3
item.description: Yesterday was the first day I did not push a blog post because, I took a break.

item.title: Rust
item.description: I’m a big rust[0] fan. It is difficult to argue why, but most likely because of feels quite alright.

item.title: Updated Tags
item.description: Today is going to be a short one: Instead of writing much, I’ve updated the tags and categories for the blog.

item.title: Generic Software is an attack avenue
item.description: As you may or may not know, one quite big hack went through the media lately, Solar Wind[0][1].

item.description: On one of my domains I had the following error message when trying to renew the Let’s Encrypt (LE) Certificate:

item.title: Power Recording
item.description: This is a follow up post for my PV. One thing that was important to me when installing the Solar-Panel was to know how much energy was generated.

item.title: nftables
item.description: In the last days I’ve been fighting with nftables. nftables is the next generation part for package filtering within the kernel space.

item.title: Review CW-2
item.description: The first week of January is completed and as every week I review what went on.

item.title: Decisions
item.description: What makes a decision a good one? What makes it a bad one?

item.title: Photo Voltaic
item.description: Since my youngest days I’m fascinated by PV-panels, Photo Voltaic or simple solar panel.

item.title: Task Warrior Recurrence
item.description: Today this is going to be a short one: I was fighting with my Task Warrior to create recurrence tasks.

item.title: Fear of Publishing
item.description: As a follow up of my yesterdays post I’ve created a new mail account for this very blog: blog@akendo.

item.title: Feedback Channels
item.description: Feedback is something we all seek for, but almost all are lacking, this blog is no exception.

item.title: Hectics
item.description: Yesterday, I had a intense conversation about the topic of hecticness.

item.title: About Habits
item.description: Habits are difficult to maintain, at least new ones. Everyone can related to this the one or the other way.

item.title: Learning Security
item.description: Security is a weird topic. For once it does not consist of defined field of its own, but instead is a generic one found in other field.

item.title: 100DaysToOffload
item.description: Hey happy new year everyone! I’m wishing everyone the best for the year of 2021!
